subsection_content:
Syphilis is a sexually transmitted infection (STI) caused by a bacteria called Treponema pallidum. According to the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, the rate of syphilis in women shows signs of decreasing, but in men, especially men who have sex with men, is increasing.
Similar to other sexually transmitted diseases, syphilis is difficult to diagnose because infected people often do not have any symptoms for many years. If syphilis infection lasts too long and is not treated properly, the disease can cause major damage to important internal organs such as the heart, brain... (1)
Some images about syphilis
